intro: Eriocaulon hondoense f. pilosum, commonly known as the hairy Hondo sedge, is a rare and specialized plant native to the island of Hondo in the Ryukyu Islands. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, cylindrical leaves. The plant is distinguished by its dense, hairy foliage, which gives it its specific epithet "pilosum." It typically grows in wet, shaded environments such as marshes and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and environmental changes.
